alert.note: Alert for Hitchcock (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 21 at 3:08PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT CENTRAL HITCHCOCK COUNTY THROUGH 345 PM CDT... At 307 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Trenton. This thunderstorm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Hitchcock County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for southwestern Nebraska.
